_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan   Executive Summary

WATER GUARD, Inc  is a chemical distributor that supplies products to municipal and industrial water and wastewater purification facilities in VA, NC and SC.  The Wilson Facility repackages a variety of water-based  chemicals and warehouses others. Safe handling and shipment is critical for our employees, our customers, and the surrounding communities. We employ 31 including 13 highly trained hazmat drivers.  These drivers also handle chlorine and sulfur dioxide cylinders for delivery. These gases, which can be toxic in high concentrations, are critical to providing safe water for many localities in NC. The facility operates approximately 12 hrs. per day and has 24 hr. surveillance.  The proximity of the facility to the other commercial areas and residential areas requires a high level of care. The risk of off-site effects are extremely unlikely, and  in the past twenty years there have been no facility accidents involving a reportable release of these chemicals. Less than catastrophic releases would be minimized within the building.

The chlorine and sulfur dioxide cylinders are received from the supplier, leak checked, and stored in secured cages.  The products are liquefied gases under low pressure (25-125 psi).  The cylinders are DOT specification heavy-walled cylinders that are not opened or modified by Water Guard . They are built to withstand normal and accident conditions incident to transportation. Our supplier inspects the cylinders each time they are filled and hydrostatically pressure tests the cylinders every 5 years to 500 psi. Chlorine Institute training materials are used and are the source of the written procedures, Safety Data Sheets and Safety checklists are used by the supplier and Water Guard Inc .

Since there are no inter-container transfers, the only threat of release from these transportation cylinders would be from a release from the fusible valve plug that activates at 160 deg F in a fire. In addit

ion, trace leaks may result from faulty supplier procedures. The isolation of the cylinders from flammable materials, valve seals, and leak check inspections control these possibilities. Employees have also been trained in the use of the full face respirators for leak checking. Respirators are maintained in different areas of the plant outside of the chlorine storage area. The facility has never had a site accident with these chemicals since construction of the facility.

All employees have received training on the standard operating procedure to follow if a chlorine leak were to occur. Evacuation drills are held. Response coordination with the local Wilson city FD is conducted and is backed up by the NC Regional Hazardous Material Response Team. We also provide the Fire Department with Tier II notification of our inventory on a yearly basis. Water Guard  has a Chlorine Institute Emergency A-Kit on site and has provided safety and emergency response training to operators and fire departments in Eastern NC. Water Guard  is also a direct subscriber with PERS for active 24 hour response infomation.

.

Note to EPA:    As the operator we have held that the isolation of these cylinders that are toxics,( not flammable), and construction of the DOT cylinders makes these cylinders not subject to the co-located guidance concerns, the NCDEQ requested this be filed under their interpretation of the general duty clause.
